website_summaries.verdict: A good gaming-specific power supply with the capability to run more powerful components.
pros: 1,000-watt capacity is good enough for most modern mid-to-high end gaming rigs
Comes with internal LED lighting to accent the surroundings during gameplay
cons: Provided power cables are on the short side
May not be compatible with some full towers

customer_reviews.title: Shorted out and killed my gaming computer
customer_reviews.text: This PSU worked fine for just under a month until it started smoking and fried most of the components in my VERY pricey gaming computer. The rep from Rosewill tried to tell me they aren't responsible for any damage done as a consequence of manufacturing deficiencies because they didn't install the product. That is contradictory to the actual definition of products liability. I wouldn't use this in your computer unless you feel like risking an electrical fire.
customer_reviews.author: M.

customer_reviews.title: Well thought out device, good pricing worth the money!.
customer_reviews.text: Having been involved in computers since 1982, I have watched the growth and transformation of products like power supplies. Newer technologies have advanced the need for forward thinking. This power supply has a large fan providing good air movement while not loud as in previous models. The design of the cable management allows you to only have cables inside the machine that needs to be there thus cutting down on clutter inside the machine that could bump into other fans, possibly causing fan stoppages on other devices like the CPU or GPU. I will buy from them again as the need arises.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Taylor

customer_reviews.title: These have terrible failure rates.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 22 of these units around the same time frame. Three units on arrival failed, one you could clearly see the broken internal solder... the other two made a good pop sound at exactly the same location. Those were returned right away, thankfully. It has been 2 months now and they are starting to fail. Two failures already, three more are suspected which I will have to test for but it is the pretty obvious common denominator at this point. Purchased other better brands that rhymes with a hodgehog and the sea... and they have been fantastic so far during the same time span.
customer_reviews.author: SupaF1y

customer_reviews.title: FAILED After 3 days! Avoid this product.
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this modular power supply. Seemed like a good price for what it was but it completely failed after just 3 days under a light load for its power output. I was dubious at first that a brand new power supply could fail so quickly, but after confirming everything else was working properly with a spare power supply I was forced to conclude that this is one very poorly constructed product. I advise others to spend a few extra dollars on something less awful.
customer_reviews.author: Collin Klopfenstein

customer_reviews.title: Good choice for moderate power loads and clean cabling...
customer_reviews.text: I like that this a semi modular power supply. I am using it in media server that I built with a Ryzen R7 1700X, GTX750Ti, 4 4TB hard disks, NVME SSD, and BluRay burner. I am using four Corsair Maglev fans along with a Corsair H55 CPU cooler. This PSU handles it all well, without being overloaded. I am using this to replace a Corsair CX500 that started failing a month ago. That PSU has been getting noisier, and when using that PSU the system would experience random stability problems. It would blue screen and restart roughly every 24 to 30 hours. With the new PSU it has run non stop for roughly two and half weeks now.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Attia

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice For The Coin
customer_reviews.text: The Power Supplies box was inspiring. It came in a good quality box and interior packaging. I loved the little cable bag it came with. I found the PS to be very easy to work with. The cables are nothing to write home about, but they are functional and do the job well. In fact, I found them to be very easy to work with. I would buy this Power Supply again and would give a recommendation to others. I would like to see a better warranty on it, but that aside, the components used in it's construction appear to be of good quality. Sound wise it was very quite.
customer_reviews.author: R. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Good features for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this unit so far. Given the other reviews I'm trying to be careful not to overload it! I'm using a power meter and trying to keep the usage below 75% rating. A great thing about this power supply is that the PCIe cables it comes with have longer than average cable length between the end ports so that they can be used with different size GPUs or GPUs that have more space between them. For the price it's been great so far.
customer_reviews.author: Joe T.

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I had a friend ask me to replace the burnt out power supply in his wife's gaming computer. They had a 450W PSU, but after I reviewed their hardware, I recommended getting something a little more powerful. After looking around online, I found the ROSEWELL Gaming 80 Plus Bronze 550W PSU. This is semi modular PSU, which was really good in my case, because the physical dimensions of this PSU were slightly larger than the previous one. It comes with plenty of cables to attach all your hardware. It also has Short-Circuit/Over-Current/Over-Voltage/Over-Power/Under-Voltage/Over-Temperature protections and a three year warranty. For this price, I'm impressed. I would definitely recommend this to anyone for a budget or mid-range gaming rig.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle B

customer_reviews.title: what I didn’t like is the click noise it makes when it boots
customer_reviews.text: Cables are not discreet but it includes all type of cables u might need, what I didn’t like is the click noise it makes when it boots , like an old tube TV but so far good for the price Edit : lately am getting warning message from AI Telling me that Vcore voltage are low And DRAM voltage are going low And 12 V is going getting 10V So am suspecting that this PSU isn’t enough or can’t handle a threadripper and a 1080Ti at the same time . Will replace the PSU to see what will happen next
customer_reviews.author: RABIH

customer_reviews.title: Boom! No really, it exploded!
customer_reviews.text: Irony at it's finest.. My window for returns expired on 5/19/17 - 10 days later and this power supply dies. It did not die peacefully thought, it went out with a bang. Luckily none of my other components were damaged when this happened. I have long been a fan of Rosewill, though this certainly leaves a sour taste in my mouth. For the month I had it, it did seem to hold up well. It's a shame really, I'd replace it but that might result in my untimely divorce, or worse.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'M OKAY WITH THIS -- COMPUTER STARTED ON THE FIRS POWER-UP
customer_reviews.text: Great PSU. Looking at the voltages on MSIs' Control-center, CPU Vcore and CPU are more stable than my old 500W Cooler Master; around 1.44v ea. 12v is also a steady 11.9v. The cables are flat and a shiny black, except for the 20/24 (20 + 4) main power connector that is shiny black sheathed. Each cable contains only one connector type, Molex on one; SATA on one, and so on. Now I'm not an expert, but the product seams ok.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Herman

customer_reviews.title: Decent, quite, and affordable power supply
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded my PC’s power supply from 550 to 700 after purchasing a new power-hungry GPU. The swap out was pretty straight forward, all the screw holes lined up to the right spots. Beyond that, I can attest to the power supply fans are indeed quiet. Definitely quieter than the old power supply I swapped out. No issue recommending this item to anyone else.
customer_reviews.author: Leo K

customer_reviews.title: Solid budget psu
customer_reviews.text: Nice power supply was cheap and its reliable. I have it powering a i7 3770 and a GTX 970 superclocked its the 550w Arc psu version. Had no problems playing games, played BF1 for a few hours seems to power it just fine. Looks good with black sleeved cables, its a bronze certified psu and have no issues thus far. Will update review after a few more months of use. Edit: Bought a 2nd PSU after the first one was still lasting good. The 2nd one is powering a GTX 680 and Phenom II x4 945. I got the 2nd about 8 months ago and is working perfectly. Not loud or no coil whine. These are solid power supply's.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Benallie

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good quality so far. It's a power supply. What more can you say. The only minus point is that it's not fully modular meaning you have all the useless thick cable strings in the case and they just clutter stuff up. But I expected that, although I wasn't sure what to make of this 'semi modular" thing that it was advertised with. I guess it means "not modular". But then, when you close the case, the cables are out of sight. Although they are a useless obstacle for the airflow. I got it on sale though and that was the main rerason I bought it
customer_reviews.author: playerdark

customer_reviews.title: Excellent supply after replacement of DOA
customer_reviews.text: All 4 SATA sockets of the supply were DOA. I asked for a replacement and will modify my comments when It arrives. The replacement just arrived, a day early, and has been installed. It is an excellent power supply. The cables are flat, small sized, and flexible enough that once positioned they stay positioned. Both SATA power cables, the only ones I'm using, have 4 power sockets. I upgraded to 5 stars due to the "aesthetics" (?) of the power supply once installed.
customer_reviews.author: DavidM

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and Quiet
customer_reviews.text: I built a workstation for creating and rendering 3D video content. It uses 6 GPUs to output 24 TFlops of computing power. After upgrading one of my video cards the computer shut down while rendering. This Rosewill Gaming 80 Plus Bronze 1000W Power Supply cost very little and is more than strong enough to handle my Ryzen 7, 6 GPU load. I'm not a big fan of the black ribbon cabling, but with this kind of power I can get used to it.
customer_reviews.author: rschiwal

customer_reviews.title: It was great..
customer_reviews.text: It was great... while it lasted. I just died last night, 10/27/2016. So, only about 7 months or so. I had no power issues, and always had it on a surge protector anyway. The only good thing is that it didn't take out my MOBO/CPU when it finally died. This seems to be an inherent issue according to reviews here and on newegg. Spend a few extra bucks and get a better brand.
customer_reviews.author: Certifried

customer_reviews.title: My computer hasn't run this quiet in 3 years!
customer_reviews.text: I've been recycling the same Gigabyte modular power supply through my last three or four builds. That sucker was getting noisy! I didn't realize how quiet and cool my PC could run until that PSU took its last breath and I bought this one by Rosewill. Easy, fast switchout and cable management. Nice!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Ladd

customer_reviews.title: Great little power box
customer_reviews.text: Rally good power supply and quite. Wires are more flexible than most and has a heavy duty power cord. Running Ryzen 7 and 2 1080 Asus Stryx GPU without any trouble and overclocked cpu at 4.5G and 32G Ram overclocked at 3200. WIN 10 Pro. I would suggest purchase elsewhere for better service than what Amazon offers. 3 of 8 packages for this build was delayed 2-3 days because they cheaper out and sent it UPS sure-post. Which means it sure to get lost/delayed by UPS somewhere.
customer_reviews.author: rcflyerjr

customer_reviews.title: It's a solid choice for a budget 450w psu, I recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I don't really have a reason to be dissatisfied, it does what was advertised, it was cheap, it's quiet, the cables are all long enough, plenty of connectors for whatever you might be using, well as much as 450w will handle. I wish it was at least semi modular, Id have rated 5 stars in ease of install, but it's hardly a deal breaker for 35 bucks. I can't speak for longevity yet, but I have high hopes.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wood

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy.
customer_reviews.text: Bought in December and dead in March. Not recommended. (Computer network admin)
customer_reviews.author: Cutwater

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: I had a semi-modular Rosewill Bronze 1000x PSU for the last two years, since I built the system. Lately, I started getting power drops and auto-reboots. Error 41 in event viewer. I found a good price on a replacement (EVGA) but when I fired up the PC, that PSU fried my Thermaltake Commander fan controller and my blu-ray drive. They are dead. Returned the EVGA and bought another Rosewill Bronze 1000w which is fully modular (this one). Haven’t had a power drop in 30 hours, so, so far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, the modular design is wonderfull. The wires and cables come with zip up bag to keep the unused cables in- I really like that Stays cool and quiet. I am very pleased and would buy again or maybe later a higher watt power supply if it was same quality warrantee and if I needed a larger one. This would also depend on a competitive. price.
customer_reviews.author: StarWitch

customer_reviews.title: Well made and Quiet
customer_reviews.text: At this point in time I’ll give this power supply 5 stars. The computer I built for my wife for basic business prossesing has been running for 5 days now with no issues. This item arrived on time with no damage. It has a nice powder coated finish, came with a detailed instruction manual, and its fan is completely silent. Note that it is not modular, meaning the cables you do not use (i.e. PCI-E power supply) can not be removed, so make sure you have room to stash unused cables.
customer_reviews.author: H. Morrison

customer_reviews.title: High power at a good cost
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I didn't give it a full five stars is because the cables need to be longer and more spaced out it's really difficult to get everything connected with the length of the cables but other than that it's pretty good power supply a lot of power for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Niah

customer_reviews.title: Impressive Power Supply 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been doing this for 20 years, building computers. I’ve never had a power supply tell me why the old one burnt up. I put it all together and a warning came up, usb high current draw and then shunt down, Impressive . Took 2 min. To find the current draw and removed it ,(camera) and no more errors. For the past week it has been running and no problems. It gets 5 Stars. Very good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Donald L. Schandel

customer_reviews.title: Quiet until it fails
customer_reviews.text: The unit is very attractive and worked flawlessly for about 18 months. Now the fan runs constantly at high speed and is quite distractedly loud. The unit still works but is annoying especially when you purchased it on the merits it had a silent running fan. I suggest passing on Rosewill. I am currently researching on a replacement pwr supply. Was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Works great, low noise
customer_reviews.text: This unit works great for my use. The cables are nice and the power supply makes little noise at the load I put it at. I only load this thing with maybe 300w max so I can't review the unit above that really. The voltage levels seem stable, but I haven't tested the mV ripple and haven't pushed it to the limit.
customer_reviews.author: Avery

customer_reviews.title: Has more power cables than you will ever need.
customer_reviews.text: Semi modular design is perfect and the cable lengths are more than adequate for long runs. Cannot hear it running. Changed my review from 5 stars to 1. After one year the power supply has now failed twice. First time it took over 2 weeks to get a replacement. This time, who knows. I am getting it replaced but only to use as a backup. Going with a more reputable power supply. This one is obviously cheaper for a reason.
customer_reviews.author: Rus

customer_reviews.title: perfect for a gaming computer
customer_reviews.text: Ahh, perfect for a gaming computer. May use it for a next gen one when I get enough money. I only have a "previous gen" computer based one the components I used, actually it's because the new gaming computer technology is out, but I can't afford a extra Grand or more, so I'll have to wait to be the electronics king. My motherboard and components barely utilizes all it's cables inside the case, but my computer is still pretty demanding sense I'm running the latest games constantly. However my computer will be surpassed, but I liked r=the value of this PSU. Thanks for the deal, it's actually a great power supply.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Purchase with caution
customer_reviews.text: This has been a challenge. Within a few months this has stopped working. It is quite unclear how to request a RMA. The Rosewill website has a form which fails to post asking the user to contact the seller. The seller is listed as Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: CuriousDawg

customer_reviews.title: terrific but a touch on the loud side
customer_reviews.text: terrific but a touch on the loud side, this is a semi modular power supply so keep that in mind, it would also have been nice if some of the wires were a lot shorter (I have a small form factor case) update; the longer length is a large hindrance when it comes to working with a small factor form machine and fan noise is indeed loud enough and such a pitch that it makes sleeping in the same room with a computer with this PSU impossible, all power cables are pretty long which honestly makes wire management difficult
customer_reviews.author: Scott Walters

customer_reviews.title: I have another Rosewill PSU that is amazing (1000W Gold)
customer_reviews.text: We got a faulty unit which caused power-surges and reboots. I have another Rosewill PSU that is amazing (1000W Gold), but I have to leave a bad review for this particular unit because it was faulty. Also, the cables are too short for a Mid tower, so I had to mount it upside down to get a little extra slack. Don't even think about this one for a full tower. Good luck everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Jake Arnet

customer_reviews.title: Runs hot/loud.
customer_reviews.text: PSU seems great quality, with enameled black paint and finished edges. MB & CPU cables are wrapped and clean, other cables seem good quality. I question if the one I had was bad (I returned it) as the fan ran at 100% all the time and was very loud. I swapped it for another popular brand and it runs way better so I do not think it was my machine.
customer_reviews.author: N. Mcclellan

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Got this PSU thinking ... semi-modular and 700w at a good deal ($50)! Yes, it works.... but wow they cut corners on the built in fan. The fan, while "quiet" enough was the loudest component in my new system. As something marketed as "silent" this is unacceptable. I took apart the unit and fan just to see since I replaced it with a Noctua and now my system truly is silent (at idle). Was amazed at how cheap this fan was as it doesn't even have bearings (just a bushing) and the plastic was so brittle it took little force to snap. Take this from someone who works as a system integrator dealing with Rosewill cases.... avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Comstock

customer_reviews.title: Longer cables needed on SATA power connections
customer_reviews.text: really wanted full Modular unit. But, this is a good unit. The only cons I have is the number of SATA power connectors one same cable (4) would be OK if spaced out about 2 inches more to make the total length about 6 inches longer. So I was only able to use 3 of the 4 connections on one cable. Then had to use the other cable for another hard drive which was only 4 inches away from the last connector on the first cable. Such is Life...
customer_reviews.author: Wfsgadbois

customer_reviews.title: Solid budget PSU
customer_reviews.text: Pretty solid PSU for the money or on a budget. No issues with the unit so far, bought and installed in December on a new build. The only thing the Mobo power connector was a little short in the Nzxt H510 it fits with out extensions however it's a bit tight for my liking while trying to keep the cables clean and manage, personal preference I would have bought a semi or full modular one for convenience and to keep the xtra cables we dont need out keeping the case less cluttered Ryzen7 2700x (stock cooler) Msi b450 tomahawk 16gb Corsair Vengeance lpx Xfx Rx5700
customer_reviews.author: BBatman

customer_reviews.title: Rosewill-- Quality as usual
customer_reviews.text: I've always had good experience's with Rosewill's components and so far this power supply is no different. Excellent quality at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: DLUV

customer_reviews.title: Killed my GPU
customer_reviews.text: So i run a SLI setup with dual gtx 970's. Just today my PC turned off and would not turn back on. Hooked up a PSU tester to the PSU and it lit up for a second then turned off. Unsure what happened i hooked up a diffrent PSU to my motherboard and gpu to test and make sure it didnt kill my board. After turning the PC on my gtx 970 sparked and caught. Smoke poored out of the GPU and i imedieatly turned the PC off. I removed the dead gtx 970 and booted with my other one in the other PCI slot. Worked fine. I would recomend EVERYONE TO STEER CLEAR OF THIS PSU.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Rosewill ARC 650 Bronze: Wont Power-on Unless Warm!
customer_reviews.text: Hundreds of boot attempts later I've come to the conclusion that this power supply just will not power on my PC unless it has been warmed up first. Thus: It unusually takes up to 10 (or more) tries for it to power on. I'll think twice about using this brand in future.
customer_reviews.author: Stv

customer_reviews.title: So far so good, works as expected
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, works as expected. Only had it for a few weeks so I can't review its lifespan. I like the modular system. If I had 1 complaint it's that some of the cables have too many plugs on the other end, and I still have a bunch of stuff tied up out of the way in my case. If you're going to go modular, go all the way, and have your cables be modular as well. Let us make them longer and shorter, add or remove plugs.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Yeager

customer_reviews.title: Really like it. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: So far I am very happy with this. I custom mounted it upside down, and cut a hole in the top of my case. This is to keep the warm air out of the case. For my setup, this was likely not necessary. It is running with very little heat. I could have used it normally for ventilation.
customer_reviews.author: Redenegue

customer_reviews.title: Very loud
customer_reviews.text: Supposed to be a self regulating fan on the PSU to keep it quiet. It sounds like the fan runs at 100% all the time. Not quiet at all. I've started a ticket request with Rosewill and have followed up with them. They say they're still waiting on engineers to respond. It's been about a month or more... Sad customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. Young

customer_reviews.title: Awesome modular PSU
customer_reviews.text: This PSU is a great bang for the buck. This is the only 80+ bronze certified, 500w MODULAR power supply I could find in this price range and it doesn't disappoint at all. This is the second time I've used this PSU and it's been great to me in both instances. Currently used to power an i3-6100 w/ Cooler Master Gemini cooler and RX 480.
customer_reviews.author: Kris B.

customer_reviews.title: Great choice
customer_reviews.text: This is my first rosewill PSU, I tend to stick more to Corsair/Cooler Master. I am very happy with it so far, it is the power supply in my latest build and is quiet and accents the lighting nicely. Cable management is easy and painless. Probably need a few years of hard running to truly win me over as a brand but so far, so good. Definitely worth a try if you're in the market.
customer_reviews.author: Keogh

customer_reviews.title: It failed after less than 1 yr
customer_reviews.text: Installed this with my gigabyte ab350 gaming MB and a Ryzen 2200G. Then one day I went to turn on the computer and there was nothing. Replaced the PSU with a Seasonic and it works fine now.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Great basic power supply
customer_reviews.text: This is a great stander power supply. Has all the connections you need. Built well and reliable. I've used Rosewill products since they first came out and very rarely had issues with there stuff. I personally wouldn't use this for a gaming tower just for a basic computer but thats me.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Really good power unit
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace my old 1200 wts cooler master, for the price this exceded my expectations and i am back in the game with my NVIDIA Titan 3 HD and and a lot of fans
customer_reviews.author: Cesar R.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time and money
customer_reviews.text: Tested okay on psu tester but would not power up my dvd drive that works with old psu. Then it fried two of my important hard drives. After seeing similar experiences with other one star raters on this product and their frustrating contacts with Rosewill, I've decided to avoid wasting any time with that avenue and just not buy any Rosewill products again. I'm returning this psu for refund.
customer_reviews.author: Overthehill

customer_reviews.title: Worth it for budgeting
customer_reviews.text: A little touchy at times when power button is pressed. Slow responding to the button being pressed to turn on, other times it works fine. A Corsair worked perfectly but this is good for the budget build, if you can’t get a Corsair for more wattage and maybe a few more dollars but this is worth the money I paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris M.

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from this PSU
customer_reviews.text: I am really serious. I don't know your setup, but besides putting this under a heavy load, there's no reason why it should last about a week. Well it did. The computer was on and suddenly "poof" power is cut never to return. This is absolutely a PoS garbage and will never buy this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Viktor

customer_reviews.title: Great, basic power supply
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son's first pc build. Nothing fancy, but had everything needed for a budget gaming rig. Quiet, but also only about 2 months old.
customer_reviews.author: J. Rader

customer_reviews.title: Good for gaming
customer_reviews.text: If you run any games on full 3d graphics and a real graphics card you will need more power under heavy load. Any OC cards and processors will also require more. I had a 650w before that would hit load and shut down completely. This holds just find at any level. Cords were a little shorter than previous PSU, but still worked.
customer_reviews.author: alan

customer_reviews.title: BadAzz!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my first personal PC build. I shopped around, looked at brands prices etc. Once I started focusing on modular and letting myself have a little more budget (for a VERY important part of your PC) this stood out. I couldn't be happier. I bought it here, but NewEgg was the one having it cheap for a limited time so Zon looked like it was simply matching. PCPartpicker dot com is great for looking at prices across the web.. 70$ bucks is the bottom price I paid HERE.. but it's way up to 90.. not sure it's worth 90, but it's perfect for my system!! fits great runs smooth!
customer_reviews.author: KCMoSoxFan

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: This power supply definitely meets my expectations and is performing better than the more expensive one I had before. It's quiet and is what the descriptions says it is. Would recommend. My only complaint is that the cable couldn't reach my disk drive so I can't use mine, but if you don't use a disk drive, it shouldn't be a problem.
customer_reviews.author: KCypher

customer_reviews.title: Power Suplly works great
customer_reviews.text: I loved this because it has plug ins for the cables and a carrying case for any extra cables. If you don't need the cables right now, you don't have to have all the extra cables in your computer. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: Great Power Supply
customer_reviews.text: Didnt need a one this big but I figured why not, packaging is nice, comes with zipper case for the spare cables. It's very quiet, and the cables were plenty long enough to be able to hide them en route to each component, have used Rosewill power supplies for years and will continue to do so. I just built this new pc, the pc it replaced has a Rosewill power supply in it still going strong after 7+ years.
customer_reviews.author: Motionb

customer_reviews.title: If your computer is tucked away somewhere under a table ...
customer_reviews.text: If your computer is tucked away somewhere under a table etc then you won't hear the fan. Fan runs at 100% at all time. Decent product for it's price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 4-8 shutdowns per day.
customer_reviews.text: I must have a defective PSU. I have updated BIOS / OS, I have monitored temps and power usage, tweaked with the sleep and hibernation settings, I have scanned across my event logs for hints and found nothing else. 4-8 times a day this will instantly kill my PC and lose all my work. Whether I am sitting at the PC, or it happens in the middle of the night while it is in sleep mode. I would appreciate a replacement to give it another shot.
customer_reviews.author: Fleet

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended for budget builds or even mid tier ones
customer_reviews.text: The power supply is the part no one should cheap out on so getting this psu for cheap and having the quality it does is a bargain. Highly recommended for budget builds or even mid tier ones. Great psu, stable and quiet fan plus a slue of cable options to use for a cheap price.. Really cant go wrong
customer_reviews.author: daniel

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a few weeks, but it's failing already
customer_reviews.text: Originally gave a good review, but after a few weeks I noticed that my PC was randomly shutting down. The time between shut downs is getting closer and closer. Last time the PSU would not even turn on, then randomly it powered back up. However, it quit about 10 minute later. I'm returning and just leaving it off until I get a new one. I would not recommend this model - generally though Rosewill makes good stuff, at least in my experience.
customer_reviews.author: hckyfan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for just about every price conscious PC builder.
customer_reviews.text: Look's well made, clean cables, runs very silent. Plenty of power to OC my 4.3ghz i5 and 2x 6 pin OC GPU. Best bang for the buck I found after hours of searching on amazon. Modular is a bonus. Product was delivered within 12 hours after ordering, which was awesome. This will suit the needs of any build short of super high end SLI. I've run several Rosewill PSUs in builds and have never had an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Chase

customer_reviews.title: Love this design, best buy!!
customer_reviews.text: This power supply was a treat to install. Modular ribbon cables that allow you to use only the cables needed to power you system. This system allows you to reverse patch what is needed and then just hook it up to the box. And it's quiet.
customer_reviews.author: RJS

customer_reviews.title: Great budget PSU
customer_reviews.text: Worked out of the boxs (proper key doesn't work), great semi-modular power supply for the money. Very nice packaging including a zipper pouch with all required cables. Runs without noise and powers my system fine.
customer_reviews.author: TimboJohnson

customer_reviews.title: Cannot provide advertised power
customer_reviews.text: Works but resets periodically under 75-80% of advertised load. I bought a 1000W unit and at 750w to 800w of usage, this psu will restart itself sporadically. Works fine at 60% load and under.
customer_reviews.author: T. Pilehvar

customer_reviews.title: Good for current build
customer_reviews.text: Worked to replaced a 750w unit that was no longer adequate for build. For the price, this is an amazing deal. i7 2600K @ 4.2 24GB DDR3 (mixed modules) Sapphire Radeon 295x2
customer_reviews.author: mr poop

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Happy with the Rosewill ARC 650W Power Supply
customer_reviews.text: Some background....I have a old Tiger Direct Systemax Venture computer from 2006 with an Intel Pentium 4 on a PM800 Motherboard. It had a Allied AL-C350ATX 350W power supply. My computer started rebooting in the middle of my Pro Tools recording sessions so I bought the Rosewill ARC 650W. This turned out to be a truly excellent choice. I swapped power supplies in about 1 hour, and the Rosewill is working like a charm. I highly recommend this excellent product!!!
customer_reviews.author: MeMeSue

customer_reviews.title: Works great, comes with a nice assortment of power cables
customer_reviews.text: It works great, and was very easy to install, with all the various power cables you might need. It was not "modular" but the included cables give you a choice of a long cable or short one of the same type, so easy to customize your setup.
customer_reviews.author: Alan RC

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, Excellent price
customer_reviews.text: The PSU came a week earlier than the expected arrival date and was well packaged. Installation was easy and any problems that I had, I chalked up to user error. As for reviews of these blowing up people's rig's, the only thing that I can imagine causing a catastrophic malfunction like that is improper seating of the connections to the PSU itself or components. I've run this thing for nearly two months straight now under heavy CPU and GPU load with no issues. 10/10 will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Sheldon

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PS
customer_reviews.text: Been running it 24/7 since I got it. It has survive endless spikes and lost power loss caused by construction on our street since I got this, Just a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Jianshe

customer_reviews.title: First PC build
customer_reviews.text: Used this in my first ever PC build. It's been 2 years now and this thing runs just fine. At first, I had a 1050Ti as a graphics card, but recently I upgraded to a Radeon RX 5600, and it powers it perfectly. Overall, not a bad product and it was a great value at the time. It's a little noisy, and it's kind of a shame that I can't change the RGB color. Also, the cables aren't modular at all which can lead to some messy cable management if you're not careful.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Obregon

customer_reviews.title: Reliable!
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty, quiet, and reliable is what I wanted. This power supply has met ALL three requirements. Runs perfect and just keeps on going on FULL load 24/7. Will order more for a data center that cannot afford ANY downtime. (For a data center that does cancer research, downtime puts lives at risk) Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: James Lee

customer_reviews.title: Superb & Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: Im not too deep into the tech side of things but I Love that it gives off a blue light. (will add pictures later) very quiet haven't had the chance to put it through the paces yet since my work load is mid- tier or range however you wanna take it. if you are a gamer and want to add some color to your rig choose this one it has more than enough power depending on what your working with i dont have all my parts yet so this may get revised later when i find time. would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Leonardo Flint

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of power and very low sound!
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time really upgrading a tower this much. The unit works great and so easy to set up. Love the ability to add and remove cables! I had to modify my Dell case for it to fit right but not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Guy

customer_reviews.title: I was going to give Rosewill some time to address ...
customer_reviews.text: I was going to give Rosewill some time to address my problem, but it's been a while with no response. The powersupply I bought had come DOA, and when I hooked it up to one of my PCs, it bricked my motherboard as well as my processor. I don't know what to do other than ward people away from this product. Cheers.
customer_reviews.author: Husain Shabani

customer_reviews.title: It was wonderful while it worked
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this power supply on the 8th of April, got it on the 11th and shortly after that it died. With that said, the RMA process and customer service I received from Rosewill was amazing. I didn't have to fight for anything and getting the PSU replaced was very hassle-free.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disapointed!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this power supply, thinking I could just store it away until I needed it trusting it will just work when I needed to, wrong! now the return window has clearly passed and I'm stuck with a $50 paper weight!! not to mention there is a 3 year warranty on it which no one seems to want to help with!!
customer_reviews.author: Darryl Clark

customer_reviews.title: Best 80+Bronze for the dollar
customer_reviews.text: I use this as my back up PSU. It runs great. It's hard to find a 80+ Bronze at such a low price and is durable. Rosewill's PSU's have been my go to for 10 years.
customer_reviews.author: UZP Customs Inc.

customer_reviews.title: works very well.
customer_reviews.text: works very well, no problems yet. appreciated price (got at 50) and modularity. could have had shrouded cables, but 50$ for modular PSU thats at least bronze certified AND 750w? good luck getting a better deal.
customer_reviews.author: A1 Original Sauce Shake Well

customer_reviews.title: Nice PSU
customer_reviews.text: I guess its dificult to review something that works ok until you challenge it, and fails.. I purchased this PSU to pair with a Fractal design Define R5, a Asus M5A99FX mobo and other parts from my old pc. This PSU has a big and silent fan, the connection rack system makes all easy to install and helps to build your system in a very neat way. I dont actually need 650W for my system but bought it looking forward to upgrade GPU, cooling etc. So Im fine for now. Regarding the packaging, it was ok. The PSU arrived without a dent. The accesories, screws, cables well packed. The product seems like high quality. Time will tell..
customer_reviews.author: Chiripa

customer_reviews.title: Copy of the purchase receipt
customer_reviews.text: How can I get the receipt for this purchase. I bought insurance from square trade and need a copy of the purchase to activate the policy.
customer_reviews.author: John Schinella

customer_reviews.title: Short cables.Worked fine.
customer_reviews.text: Cables are a little short could easily use an inch or two more, but there are more than enough to power all your gear. Packaged well. PSU seems very sturdy. Started up just fine after installation.
customer_reviews.author: vykker

customer_reviews.title: and I'm pleased with it
customer_reviews.text: I've had this powering my gaming rig for quite a few months now, and I'm pleased with it. It's modular design allowed me to only use the cables I needed to keep my tower free from clutter, which keeps my airflow in pristine condition. The device itself is about average as far as noise is concerned, but it does a good job at keeping itself cool and providing some unintended extra airflow in my rig.
customer_reviews.author: Brendyn Van Demark

customer_reviews.title: Silent Power Delivery
customer_reviews.text: Great PSU so far. I bought this to replace a cheap power supply that was on my desktop. The older PSU made a lot of noise which was very annoying to me especially when using it at night. The Rosewill PSU is super quiet. I never hear it even at 3AM when everything is dead silent. The modular cables are great for reducing clutter. However, I do think that the cables are a bit too stiff and can be a bit difficult maneuvering them around the appropriate spot. It's a fantastic product and I really recommend for any build.
customer_reviews.author: TonyR

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper than it used to be.
customer_reviews.text: Cheaper than it used to be. Cables no longer rounded with the protective sheath around them. They are now plastic flat ribbon cables. The actual power supply has more power to some rails, and hopefully it's quality has not lessened. And, the new cables will work just fine - just not as pretty.
customer_reviews.author: MikeBWCA

customer_reviews.title: Totally silent with tons of power for 3xSLI systems and enough modular connectors for large NAS setups.Lots of extra adapters.
customer_reviews.text: Totally silent fan. Tons of modular cables that are plenty long. extra fan cable adapters and plenty of 6 and 8 pin PCIe-x connectors. More molex connectors than anyone should need these days, and plenty of sata connectors for a NAS server with good distances between connectors. Cable ties included.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Rofl

customer_reviews.title: Great budget PSU
customer_reviews.text: Great budget PSU. Pros: Semi-modular makes cable management very easy. Overall the unit is pretty quiet and haven't had any issues with heat. Cons: every once in a while you can hear the fan but typically it is undetectable.
customer_reviews.author: Josh C

customer_reviews.title: Silence and Modular
customer_reviews.text: Super silence, semi modular, efficiency PFC Bronze 80, cables are long enough and easy to handle, colors does match with my black & white PC Case, what else? - :)
customer_reviews.author: Danny Boy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product.
customer_reviews.text: Great power delivery with NO noise. No sense getting anything higher than bronze+ unless you REALLY want to spend another 20$+ to save ~$10 a year if you get a gold or higher.
customer_reviews.author: jake

customer_reviews.title: ... really debating getting this power supply after reading several bad reviews, but despite the reviews my rosewill arc ...
customer_reviews.text: I was really debating getting this power supply after reading several bad reviews, but despite the reviews my rosewill arc 450W power supply is standing strong. I have had this product for about a week now so I can’t really review its lifespan but I will update as needed. If you are going for a budget build this is a product to consider but if are building a high end rig then I recommend you get something a little better than this.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan Long

customer_reviews.title: Semi Modular PSU
customer_reviews.text: Put into a Thermaltake Core V1 ITX case. Cables are longer than needed for that size case, but the PSU isn't designed for that so can't complain. Sleeving is good and its not overly loud. Runs on a computer that runs 24/7 and have had no issues
customer_reviews.author: Tom W

customer_reviews.title: Very good psu.
customer_reviews.text: Good 650w 80+ cert. power supply at this price point. Although I did get it on a Black Friday sale. Just as easy as any other non modular psu to install. This is the first Rosewill psu I ever used but it feels and looks well made and solid. Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Al A.

customer_reviews.title: 850 watt version better for modern computer builds
customer_reviews.text: For a little more get the 850watt version Power hungry CPU’s, video GPU’s and watercoolers really need an 850
customer_reviews.author: Matthew De Jongh

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: All good, I bought this Power Supply for mining. But i wouldnt buy it again for mining. The reason is that it has only 3x 8pin and 3x 6pin VGA power supply connectors . Most of time this kind of power supplies offers at least 4x 8pin.
customer_reviews.author: Elnur

customer_reviews.title: so tying them off totally neatly behind the mobo was just annoying enough I didn't bother
customer_reviews.text: It works, it's cheap, it has all the connections I need and it's modular. Cons? The cables are a bit stiff and wide, so tying them off totally neatly behind the mobo was just annoying enough I didn't bother, but it's behind the mobo panel, I don't care.
customer_reviews.author: Ailith

customer_reviews.title: Well Designed
customer_reviews.text: The best part of this power supply is the row of sockets... it allows you to plug in just the cables you need for your hard drives, dvd drives and other peripherals.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Black

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet.
customer_reviews.text: I am using it as an external to power NVidia GTX 1080Ti in the upgraded Mac Pro (original power supply can only handle up to 780). Very quiet, big fan. Long cables allow me to run power into Mac through opening in the back.
customer_reviews.author: MikeA

customer_reviews.title: Good price point, better than expected performance, crowded case convenient, great buy
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my new custom PC built around the latest Maxwell architecture Nvidia 900 series and Intel Haswell. my cases nothing extraordinary just an average midsize ATX box and I cannot hear this fan even during the most demanding full graphics settings to video optimizing application computer stressors. the air even feels cool coming out the back at that time. modular is the way to go
customer_reviews.author: Sebring

customer_reviews.title: No problem
customer_reviews.text: Dead after a month. I thought all PSUs were reasonably reliable and I was wrong. Going with an EVGA now. EDIT: LOL. This PSU was fine. I should have tested more thoroughly. The problem was with my EVGA 1070 which caught fire when I installed a new PSU. Sorry Rosewill, your product is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: Just purring along
customer_reviews.text: Installed it with a Gigabyte Gaming Wifi ITX motherboard and a nVidia GTX 1050 graphics card. So far no issues. The motherboard recommends a 500W power supply, but so far I haven't had any issues.
customer_reviews.author: William Clyde

product_meta.title: Rosewill Gaming Power Supply/PSU, 1000 Watt (1000W) 80 Plus Bronze Certified PSU with Silent and Blue LED 135mm Fan and Auto Fan Speed Control, Semi-Modular Design, RBR-1000MS
product_meta.description:
Style:RBR| Size:1000W

Rosewill's RBR1000-MS satisfies your power-hungry virtual instincts, and keeps you running at your best.

Specifications

Type: ATX12V v2.3 / EPS12V
Maximum Power: Continuous 1000W@40°C
Fans: 135mm Blue LED Dual-ball-bearing
PFC: Active
Main Connector: 20+4Pin
+12V Rails: 1
PCI-Express Connector: 3 x 6-Pin, 3 x 6+2-Pin
SATA Power Connector: 12
SLI: Ready
CrossFire: Ready
Modular: Modular
Efficiency: Up to 85%
Energy-Efficient: 80 PLUS BRONZE Certified
Over Voltage Protection: Yes
Overload Protection: Yes
Input Voltage: 100 - 240V
Input Frequency Range: 47 - 63Hz
Input Current: 13A
Output: +3.3V@28A, +5V@30A, +12V1@20A, +12V2@20A, +12V3@30A, +12V4@30A, -12V@0.8A, +5VSB@3.0A
MTBF: >100,000 Hours
Approvals: UL, CUL, TUV, CB, FCC, ROHS
Dimensions: 5.91" x 6.3" x 3.39"

Connectors

1 x 20+4-Pin Main Connector
1 x 4+4-Pin ATX12V/EPS12V Connector
1 x 8-pin EPS12V Connector
3 x 6-Pin PCI-E Connector
3 x 6+2-Pin PCI-E Connector
12 x 5-Pin SATA Connector
6 x 4-Pin Peripheral Connector
2 x 4-Pin Floppy Connector
feature_bullets: Gaming 1000W Blue LED Fan Power Supplies: Rosewill RBR-1000MS is a professional power supply to support your gaming desktop computer system and an ideal solution to deliver high availability, scalability, maximum flexibility and price/performance.

Silent Operation: The gaming 80Plus power supply is equipped with one 135mm fan to offer extraordinary airflow at an exceptional low noise level by different speed level in response to various temperature.

80+ Bronze Certified: 80 Plus bronze certified power supplies to deliver 80% or more efficiency at a normal loading conditions and outstanding Short-Circuit/Over-Current/Over-Voltage/Over-Power/Under-Voltage/Over-Temperature Protections.
Semi-Modular Cable Design: The semi-modular cable design allows for easy installation, reduces system clutter, and helps maximize airflow through your computer’s chassis.
UL, FCC, CE Certificated: With UL, FCC, and CE Certification, Rosewill ARC series power supplies with strong single +12V rail provide high efficiency operation for less heat and lower operating loss.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,114 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
